In his classic summary of this field of psychological research, "Identity: Youth and Crisis", Erikson summarized the wisdom dimension of the lifespan development cycle this way (pages 140-141): '''''"Strength here takes the form of that detached yet active concern with life bounded by death, which we call wisdom...Not that each man can evolve wisdom for himself...To whatever abyss ultimate concerns may lead individual men, man as a psychological creature will face, toward the end of his life, a new edition of the identity crisis which we may state by the words 'I am what survives me' ".'''''
     
It seems quite remarkable that the concept of ''''''wisdom' surfaces as a universal optimal living experience''''' within the psychological space of all individuals.<ref>Brown, S. C., & Greene, J. A. (2006). The Wisdom Development Scale: Translating the conceptual to the concrete.
